info.title: Monero Daemon RPC
info.description: JSON-RPC API for interacting with monero daemon (Actual RPC standard is based on monerod)

servers.name: Monero daemon address
servers.summary: Address of the monero daemon to interact with

count.description: Number of blocks in longest chain seen by the node.

status.description: General RPC error code. 'OK' means everything looks good.

untrusted.description: States if the result is obtained using the bootstrap mode, and is therefore not trusted (`true`), or when the daemon is fully synced and thus handles the RPC locally (`false`)

blocktemplate_blob.description: Blob on which to try to mine a new block.

blockhashing_blob.description: Blob on which to try to find a valid nonce.

difficulty.description: Least-significant 64 bits of the 128-bit network difficulty.

difficulty_top64.description: Most-significant 64 bits of the 128-bit network difficulty.

expected_reward.description: Coinbase reward expected to be received if block is successfully mined.

next_seed_hash.description: Hash of the next block to use as seed for Random-X proof-of-work.

prev_hash.description: Hash of the most recent block on which to mine the next block.

seed_hash.description: Hash of block to use as seed for Random-X proof-of-work.

seed_height.description: Height of block to use as seed for Random-X proof-of-work.

status.description: General RPC error code. 'OK' means everything looks good.

untrusted.description: States if the result is obtained using the bootstrap mode, and is therefore not trusted (true), or when the daemon is fully synced and thus handles the RPC locally (false)

wide_difficulty.description: Network difficulty (analogous to the strength of the network) as a hexadecimal string representing a 128-bit number.

height.description: Height of the most recent block.

status.description: General RPC error code. 'OK' means everything looks good.

untrusted.description: States if the result is obtained using the bootstrap mode, and is therefore not trusted (`true`), or when the daemon is fully synced and thus handles the RPC locally (`false`)

BlockHeader.description: A structure containing block header information.

block_size.description: Backward compatibility, same as `block_weight`, use that instead

block_weight.description: The adjusted block size, in bytes. This is the raw size, plus a positive adjustment for any Bulletproof transactions with more than 2 outputs.

cumulative_difficulty.description: Least-significant 64 bits of the cumulative difficulty of all blocks up to the block in the reply.

cumulative_difficulty_top64.description: Most-significant 64 bits of the 128-bit cumulative difficulty.

depth.description: The number of blocks succeeding this block on the blockchain. A larger number means an older block.

difficulty.description: The strength of the Monero network based on mining power.

difficulty_top64.description: Most-significant 64 bits of the 128-bit network difficulty.

height.description: The number of blocks preceding this block on the blockchain.

long_term_weight.description: The long term block weight, based on the median weight of the preceding 100000 blocks.

major_version.description: The major version of the monero protocol at this block height.

miner_tx_hash.description: The hash of this block's coinbase transaction.

minor_version.description: The minor version of the monero protocol at this block height.

nonce.description: A cryptographic random one-time number used in mining a Monero block

num_txes.description: Number of transactions in the block, excluding the coinbase tx.

orphan_status.description: Usually `false`. If `true`, this block is not part of the longest chain.

pow_hash.description: The hash, as a hexadecimal string, calculated from the block as proof-of-work.

prev_hash.description: The hash of the block immediately preceding this block in the chain.

reward.description: The amount of new [atomic units](https://www.getmonero.org/resources/moneropedia/atomic-units.html) generated in this block and rewarded to the miner. Note: 1 XMR = 1e12 [atomic units](https://www.getmonero.org/resources/moneropedia/atomic-units.html)

timestamp.description: The unix time at which the block was recorded into the blockchain.

wide_cumulative_difficulty.description: Cumulative difficulty of all blocks in the blockchain as a hexadecimal string representing a 128-bit number.

wide_difficulty.description: Network difficulty (analogous to the strength of the network) as a hexadecimal string representing a 128-bit number.

credits.description: If payment for RPC is enabled, the number of credits available to the requesting client. Otherwise, 0.

status.description: General RPC error code. "OK" means everything looks good.

top_hash.description: If payment for RPC is enabled, the hash of the highest block in the chain. Otherwise, empty. (Warning, payment for RPC is deprecated)

untrusted.description: States if the result is obtained using the bootstrap mode, and is therefore not trusted (`true`), or when the daemon is fully synced and thus handles the RPC locally (`false`)

status.description: General RPC error code. "OK" means everything looks good.

untrusted.description: States if the result is obtained using the bootstrap mode, and is therefore not trusted (`true`), or when the daemon is fully synced and thus handles the RPC locally (`false`)

credits.description: If payment for RPC is enabled, the number of credits available to the requesting client. Otherwise, 0.

headers.description: array of `block_header` (a structure containing block header information. See `get_last_block_header`).

status.description: General RPC error code. "OK" means everything looks good.

top_hash.description: If payment for RPC is enabled, the hash of the highest block in the chain. Otherwise, empty. (Warning, payment for RPC is deprecated)

untrusted.description: States if the result is obtained using the bootstrap mode, and is therefore not trusted (`true`), or when the daemon is fully synced and thus handles the RPC locally (`false`)

major_version.description: The major version of the monero protocol at this block height.

minor_version.description: The minor version of the monero protocol at this block height.

timestamp.description: The unix time at which the block was recorded into the blockchain.

prev_id.description: The hash of the block immediately preceding this block in the chain.

nonce.description: A cryptographic random one-time number used in mining a Monero block

unlock_time.description: The block height when the coinbase transaction becomes spendable.

gen.description: Miner txs are coinbase txs, or "gen".

height.description: This block height, a.k.a. when the coinbase is generated.

key.description: The public key of the output

view_tag.description: The 1st byte of a shared secret in hex string (used for reducing synchronization time)

extra.description: Usually called the "transaction ID" but can be used to include any random 32 byte/64 character hex string.

rct_signatures.description: Contain signatures of tx signers. Coinbased txs do not have signatures.

tx_hashes.description: List of hashes of non-coinbase transactions in the block. If there are no other transactions, this will be an empty list.

credits.description: If payment for RPC is enabled, the number of credits available to the requesting client. Otherwise, 0.

json.description: JSON formatted block details, see `BlockDetails` component

status.description: General RPC error code. "OK" means everything looks good.

top_hash.description: If payment for RPC is enabled, the hash of the highest block in the chain. Otherwise, empty. (Warning, payment for RPC is deprecated)

untrusted.description: States if the result is obtained using the bootstrap mode, and is therefore not trusted (`true`), or when the daemon is fully synced and thus handles the RPC locally (`false`)

address.description: The peer's address, actually IPv4 & port.

avg_download.description: Average bytes of data uploaded by node.

incoming.description: Is the node getting information from your node?

live_time.description: The time elapsed from now to the connection with this peer

local_ip.description: `true` if part of the node's local network, `false` otherwise

peer_id.description: The node's ID on the network.

port.description: The port that the node is using to connect to the network.

status.description: General RPC error code. "OK" means everything looks good.

untrusted.description: States if the result is obtained using the bootstrap mode, and is therefore not trusted (`true`), or when the daemon is fully synced and thus handles the RPC locally (`false`)

adjusted_time.description: Current time approximated from chain data, as Unix time.

alt_blocks_count.description: Number of alternative blocks to main chain.

block_size_limit.description: Backward compatibility, same as `block_weight_limit`, use that instead

block_size_median.description: Backward compatibility, same as `block_weight_median`, use that instead

block_weight_limit.description: Maximum allowed adjusted block size based on latest 100000 blocks

block_weight_median.description: Median adjusted block size of latest 100000 blocks

bootstrap_daemon_address.description: [Bootstrap node](https://www.getmonero.org/resources/moneropedia/bootstrap-node.html) to give immediate usability to wallets while syncing by proxying RPC to it. (Note: the replies may be untrustworthy).

busy_syncing.description: States if new blocks are being added (`true`) or not (`false`).

credits.description: If payment for RPC is enabled, the number of credits available to the requesting client. Otherwise, 0.

cumulative_difficulty.description: Least-significant 64 bits of the cumulative difficulty of all blocks up to the block in the reply.

cumulative_difficulty_top64.description: Most-significant 64 bits of the 128-bit cumulative difficulty.

database_size.description: The size of the blockchain database, in bytes.

difficulty.description: Least-significant 64 bits of the 128-bit network difficulty.

difficulty_top64.description: Most-significant 64 bits of the 128-bit network difficulty.

free_space.description: Available disk space on the node. (0 if RPC is restricted)

height.description: Current length of longest chain known to daemon.

height_without_bootstrap.description: Current length of the local chain of the daemon.

incoming_connections_count.description: Number of peers connected to and pulling from your node.

mainnet.description: States if the node is on the mainnet (`true`), or not (`false`).

offline.description: States if the node is offline (`true`) or online (`false`).

outgoing_connections_count.description: Number of peers that you are connected to and getting information from.

rpc_connections_count.description: Number of RPC client connected to the daemon (Including this RPC request).

stagenet.description: States if the node is on the stagenet (`true`), or not (`false`).

start_time.description: Start time of the daemon, as UNIX time.

status.description: General RPC error code. "OK" means everything looks good.

synchronized.description: States if the node is synchronized (`true`) or not (`false`).

target.description: Current target for next proof of work.

target_height.description: The height of the next block in the chain.

testnet.description: States if the node is on the testnet (`true`), or not (`false`).

top_block_hash.description: Hash of the highest block in the chain.

top_hash.description: If payment for RPC is enabled, the hash of the highest block in the chain. Otherwise, empty. (Warning, payment for RPC is deprecated)

tx_count.description: Total number of non-coinbase transaction in the chain.

tx_pool_size.description: Number of transactions that have been broadcast but not included in a block.

untrusted.description: States if the result is obtained using the bootstrap mode, and is therefore not trusted (`true`), or when the daemon is fully synced and thus handles the RPC locally (`false`)

update_available.description: States if a newer Monero software version is available.

version.description: The version of the Monero software the node is running.

was_bootstrap_ever_used.descripion: States if a bootstrap node has ever been used since the daemon started.

wide_cumulative_difficulty.description: Cumulative difficulty of all blocks in the blockchain as a hexadecimal string representing a 128-bit number.

wide_difficulty.description: Network difficulty (analogous to the strength of the network) as a hexadecimal string representing a 128-bit number.

methods.name: get_block_count
methods.description: Look up how many blocks are in the longest chain known to the node.

methods.name: on_get_block_hash
methods.description: Look up a block's hash by its height.

params.name: block height
params.description: integer array of length 1 (example: `[54666]`)

methods.name: get_block_template
methods.description: Get a block template on which mining a new block.

params.name: wallet_address
params.description: Address of wallet to receive coinbase transactions if block is successfully mined.

params.name: reserve_size
params.description: Reserve size.

methods.name: submit_block
methods.description: Submit a mined block to the network.

params.name: Block blob data
params.description: list of block blobs which have been mined. See `get_block_template` to get a blob on which to mine.

methods.name: generateblocks
methods.description: Submit a mined block to the network.

params.name: amount_of_blocks
params.description: Number of blocks to be generated.

params.name: wallet_address
params.description: address to receive the coinbase reward.

params.name: prev_block
params.description: No description is provided since this field is deprecated

params.name: starting_nonce
params.description: Increased by miner untill it finds a matching result that solves a block.

methods.name: generateblocks
methods.description: Submit a mined block to the network.

params.name: amount_of_blocks
params.description: Number of blocks to be generated.

params.name: wallet_address
params.description: address to receive the coinbase reward.

params.name: prev_block
params.description: No description is provided since this field is deprecated

params.name: starting_nonce
params.description: Increased by miner untill it finds a matching result that solves a block.

methods.name: get_last_block_header
methods.description: Block header information for the most recent block is easily retrieved with this method. No inputs are needed.

params.name: fill_pow_hash
params.description: (Optional; defaults to `false`) Add PoW hash to block_header response.

methods.name: get_block_header_by_hash
methods.description: Block header information can be retrieved using either a block's hash or height. This method includes a block's hash as an input parameter to retrieve basic information about the block.

params.name: hash
params.description: The block's sha256 hash.

params.name: fill_pow_hash
params.description: (Optional; defaults to `false`) Add PoW hash to block_header response.

methods.name: get_block_header_by_height
methods.description: Similar to `get_block_header_by_hash`, this method includes a block's height as an input parameter to retrieve basic information about the block.

params.name: height
params.description: The block's height.

params.name: fill_pow_hash
params.description: (Optional; defaults to `false`) Add PoW hash to block_header response.

methods.name: get_block_headers_range
methods.description: Similar to `get_block_header_by_height`, but for a range of blocks. This method includes a starting block height and an ending block height as parameters to retrieve basic information about the range of blocks.

params.name: start_height
params.description: The starting block's height.

params.name: end_height
params.description: The ending block's height.

params.name: fill_pow_hash
params.description: (Optional; defaults to `false`) Add PoW hash to block_header response.

methods.name: get_block
methods.description: Full block information can be retrieved by either block height or hash, like with the above block header calls. For full block information, both lookups use the same method, but with different input parameters.

params.name: height
params.description: The block's height. If not defined, `hash` field must be defined

params.name: end_height
params.description: The block's hash. If not defined, `height` field must be defined

params.name: fill_pow_hash
params.description: (Optional; defaults to `false`) Add PoW hash to block_header response.

methods.name: get_connections
methods.description: Retrieve information about incoming and outgoing connections to your node. (Warning: This method is unavailable if the node have set restricted RPC)

methods.name: get_info
methods.description: Retrieve general information about the state of your node and the network.
